words.definition: To accumulate something is to collect a lot of it over time.
words.example: The mail accumulated in their mailbox while they were on vacation.

words.definition: When something is aerial, it relates to being in the air or flying.
words.example: The aerial photographer took pictures from the air balloon.

words.definition: An apparatus is a device used for a particular purpose.
words.example: The campers had an apparatus that showed them their exact location.

words.definition: An avalanche is a large amount of snow, ice, and rock falling off a mountain.
words.example: The avalanche destroyed the mountain village.

words.definition: Consistency is the state of always behaving in the same way.
words.example: Her consistency in archery meant that our team had a chance to win.

words.definition: Convection is the flow of hot air through gas or liquid.
words.example: The weather changed because of convection in the atmosphere.

words.definition: To discharge someone is to allow them to leave from a place, usually a hospital.
words.example: I was discharged from the hospital after three days.

words.definition: When something is intact, it is complete and not damaged.
words.example: Despite being over ten years old, my father’s model ship is still intact.

words.definition: When a person is mortal, they cannot live forever.
words.example: All people are mortal.

words.definition: An omen is a sign of what will happen in the future.
words.example: He thought that seeing a black cat in the street was an omen of bad luck.

words.definition: When the sky is overcast, it is full of clouds and is not sunny.
words.example: The sky was overcast in the morning, but by noon it was sunny.

words.definition: When something is poignant, it causes a feeling of sadness.
words.example: The movie’s ending was very poignant.

words.definition: A ranger is a person who protects a forest or park.
words.example: The park ranger gave us directions to the waterfall.

words.definition: Rubble is the piles of broken stone and brick from a destroyed building.
words.example: The rescue team searched through the rubble for survivors.

words.definition: To seclude someone means to keep them away from other people.
words.example: He secluded himself in his study to work on his book.

words.definition: If something moves sideways, it moves to or from the side.
words.example: The car slid sideways on the icy road.

words.definition: To sob means to cry loudly with short breaths.
words.example: She sobbed when she heard the sad news.

words.definition: When someone is sober, they are not drunk.
words.example: The driver was sober and alert.

words.definition: A speck is a very small mark or piece of something.
words.example: There was a speck of dust on his coat.

words.definition: Upbringing is the way a child is raised.
words.example: His strict upbringing made him a very disciplined person.
